member.name: T:ASCOM.Alpaca.Clients.AlpacaClient
member.summary: Helper functions to return an instance of an Alpaca client
Create an Alpaca client for a discovered ASCOM device specifying all parameters
member.param: An AscomDevice instance representing the device to use (mandatory parameter)
Communications timeout (seconds) when initially connecting to the client. Default: 3 seconds
Communications timeout (seconds) for commands that are expected to complete quickly. Default: 3 seconds
Communications timeout (seconds) for commands that are expected to take a long time such as synchronous telescope slews. Default: 100 seconds
Arbitrary number identifying this particular client. Default: 1
Basic authentication user name. Supply a or empty string if basic authentication is not required. Default: Empty string
Basic authentication password. Ignored if password is or an empty string. Default: Empty string
Set true to require strict JSON casing in device responses.. Default: true
ILogger instance or null. Default: null
Image array transfer type (Only relevant to Camera devices). Default: ImageArrayTransferType.BestAvailable
Image array compression type (Only relevant to Camera devices). Default: ImageArrayCompression.None
User agent header product name. Default: Not added to header.
User agent header product version. Default: Not added to header.
Trust user generated SSL certificates. Default: User generated SSL certificates are not trusted.
member.returns: An Alpaca client instance for the supplied device and configuration
member.remarks: ASCOM Camera client specific parameters can be set through the and properties.

member.summary: Create an Alpaca client instance specifying all available parameters
member.typeparam: .NET object type of the device to create e.g. AlpacaCamera, AlpacaTelescope,AlpacaFocuser etc.
member.param: HTTP or HTTPS as a ServiceType Default: ServiceType.Http
The device's IP address Default: 127.0.0.1
The device's IP port number Default: 11111
The Alpaca device number of this ASCOM device Default: 0
Communications timeout (seconds) when initially connecting to the client. Default: 3 seconds
Communications timeout (seconds) for commands that are expected to complete quickly. Default: 3 seconds
Communications timeout (seconds) for commands that are expected to take a long time such as synchronous telescope slews. Default: 100 seconds
Arbitrary number identifying this particular client. Default: 1
Basic authentication user name. Supply a or empty string if basic authentication is not required. Default: Empty string
Basic authentication password. Ignored if password is or an empty string. Default: Empty string
Set true to require strict JSON casing in device responses.. Default: true
ILogger instance or null. Default: null
Image array transfer type (Only relevant to Camera devices). Default: ImageArrayTransferType.BestAvailable
Image array compression type (Only relevant to Camera devices). Default: ImageArrayCompression.None
User agent header product name. Default: Not added to header.
User agent header product version. Default: Not added to header.
Trust user generated SSL certificates. Default: User generated SSL certificates are not trusted.
member.returns: An Alpaca client of the specified type

member.name: T:ASCOM.Alpaca.Clients.AlpacaCamera
member.summary: ASCOM Alpaca Camera client

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Clients.AlpacaCamera.#ctor
member.summary: Create a client for an Alpaca Camera device with all parameters set to default values
Create a client for an Alpaca Camera device specifying all parameters
member.param: HTTP or HTTPS
Alpaca device's IP Address
Alpaca device's IP Port number
Alpaca device's device number e.g. Telescope/0
Timeout (seconds) to initially connect to the Alpaca device
Timeout (seconds) for transactions that are expected to complete quickly e.g. retrieving CanXXX properties
Timeout (seconds) for transactions that are expected to take a long time to complete e.g. Camera.ImageArray
Arbitrary integer that represents this client. (Should be the same for all transactions from this client)
Specifies the method to be used to retrieve the ImageArray property value.
Extent to which the ImageArray data stream should be compressed.
Basic authentication user name for the Alpaca device
basic authentication password for the Alpaca device
Tolerate or throw exceptions if the Alpaca device does not use strictly correct casing for JSON object element names.
Optional ILogger instance that can be sued to record operational information during execution
Optional product name to include in the User-Agent HTTP header sent to the Alpaca device
Optional product version to include in the User-Agent HTTP header sent to the Alpaca device
Trust user generated SSL certificates

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Clients.AlpacaCamera.#ctor(ASCOM.Common.Alpaca.ServiceType,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,ASCOM.Common.Interfaces.ILogger)
member.summary: Create a client for an Alpaca Camera device specifying the minimum number of parameters
member.param: HTTP or HTTPS
Alpaca device's IP Address
Alpaca device's IP Port number
Alpaca device's device number e.g. Telescope/0
Tolerate or throw exceptions if the Alpaca device does not use strictly correct casing for JSON object element names.
Optional ILogger instance that can be sued to record operational information during execution

Alpaca device's IP Address
Alpaca device's IP Port number
Alpaca device's device number e.g. Telescope/0
Timeout (seconds) to initially connect to the Alpaca device
Timeout (seconds) for transactions that are expected to complete quickly e.g. retrieving CanXXX properties
Timeout (seconds) for transactions that are expected to take a long time to complete e.g. Camera.ImageArray
Arbitrary integer that represents this client. (Should be the same for all transactions from this client)
Specifies the method to be used to retrieve the ImageArray property value.
Extent to which the ImageArray data stream should be compressed.
Basic authentication user name for the Alpaca device
basic authentication password for the Alpaca device
Tolerate or throw exceptions if the Alpaca device does not use strictly correct casing for JSON object element names.

member.name: T:ASCOM.Alpaca.Clients.AlpacaDeviceBaseClass
member.summary: Base class for Alpaca client devices

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Clients.AlpacaDeviceBaseClass.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new instance of the AlpacaDeviceBaseClass passing the instance to the client configuration class

member.name: P:ASCOM.Alpaca.Clients.AlpacaDeviceBaseClass.ClientConfiguration
member.summary: Provide access to the client configuration
member.remarks: The returned instance properties can be used to read and change the client's configuration. If any values are changed, the method must be called to bring the changes into effect.

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Clients.AlpacaDeviceBaseClass.RefreshClient
member.summary: Updates the internal HTTP client with a new instance.
member.remarks: This method must be called after changing the client configuration through the property.

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Clients.AlpacaDeviceBaseClass.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose call used by the CLR during clean-up. Do not use this method, use instead.

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Clients.AlpacaDeviceBaseClass.Dispose
member.summary: This method is a "clean-up" method that is primarily of use to drivers that are written in languages such as C# and VB.NET where resource clean-up is initially managed by the language's runtime garbage collection mechanic. Driver authors should take care to ensure that a client or runtime calling Dispose() does not adversely affect other connected clients. Applications should not call this method.

member.name: T:ASCOM.Alpaca.Clients.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Alpaca Client toolkit providing a standard interface to Alpaca devices. This namespace is delivered in NuGet package: ASCOM.Alpaca.Components.

remarks.para: Please note that you will need to add this PropertyGroup to .NET projects that target Android in order for Alpaca discovery to work as expected:
This may also be the case for projects that target IOS, but has not yet been confirmed

member.name: T:ASCOM.Alpaca.Discovery.AlpacaDiscovery
member.summary: Enables clients to discover Alpaca devices by sending one or more discovery polls. Returns information on discovered Alpaca devices and the ASCOM devices that are available.

remarks.para: The discovery process is asynchronous and is initiated by the method. Clients can then either work synchronously by looping and periodically polling the property or work asynchronously by handling the and events while doing other work.

The method is used to set the character of the discovery e.g. the discovery duration and whether to search for IPv4 and/or IPv6 devices. After the specified discovery duration, the event fires and the property returns True.

Once discovery is complete, .NET clients can retrieve details of discovered Alpaca devices and associated ASCOM interface devices through the and methods. COM clients must use the and properties because COM does not support the generic classes used in the and methods.

member.summary: Initialise the Alpaca discovery component

member.summary: Initialiser that takes a trace logger (Can only be used from .NET clients)
member.param: Trace logger instance to use for activity logging

Product version in the User-Agent header of management API HTTP calls

member.summary: Call used by the CLR during disposal. Do not call this method, use instead.

member.name: E:ASCOM.Alpaca.Discovery.AlpacaDiscovery.AlpacaDevicesUpdated
member.summary: Raised every time information about discovered devices is updated

member.name: E:ASCOM.Alpaca.Discovery.AlpacaDiscovery.DiscoveryCompleted
member.summary: Raised when the discovery is complete
member.remarks: This event is only available to .NET clients. COM clients should poll the property periodically to determine when discovery is complete.

member.name: P:ASCOM.Alpaca.Discovery.AlpacaDiscovery.DiscoveryComplete
member.summary: Flag that indicates when a discovery cycle is complete
member.remarks: The discovery is considered complete when the time period specified on the method is exceeded.

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Discovery.AlpacaDiscovery.GetAlpacaDevicesAsArrayList
member.summary: Returns an ArrayList of discovered Alpaca devices for use by COM clients
member.remarks: This method is for use by COM clients because it is not possible to pass a generic list as used in through a COM interface. .NET clients should use instead of this method.

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Discovery.AlpacaDiscovery.GetAlpacaDevices
member.summary: Returns a generic List of discovered Alpaca devices.
member.remarks: This method is only available to .NET clients because COM cannot handle generic types. COM clients should use .

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Discovery.AlpacaDiscovery.GetAscomDevicesAsArrayList(System.Nullable{ASCOM.Common.DeviceTypes})
member.summary: Returns an ArrayList of discovered ASCOM devices, of the specified device type, for use by COM clients
member.param: The device type for which to search e.g. Telescope, Use to return devices of all types.

remarks.para: This method is for use by COM clients because it is not possible to return a generic list, as used in , through a COM interface. .NET clients should use instead of this method.
This method will return every discovered device, regardless of device type, if the supplied "deviceType" parameter is null.

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Discovery.AlpacaDiscovery.GetAscomDevices(System.Nullable{ASCOM.Common.DeviceTypes})
member.summary: Returns a generic list of discovered ASCOM devices of the specified device type.
member.param: The device type for which to search e.g. Telescope, Focuser. Use to return devices of all types.

remarks.para: This method is only available to .NET clients because COM cannot handle generic types. COM clients should use .
This method will return every discovered device, regardless of device type, if the supplied "deviceType" parameter is null.

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Discovery.AlpacaDiscovery.StartDiscovery(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,ASCOM.Common.Alpaca.ServiceType)
member.summary: Start an Alpaca device discovery based on the supplied parameters
member.param: Number of polls to send in the range 1 to 5 (Default 1)
Interval (milliseconds) between each poll in the range 10 to 5000 milliseconds (Default 100ms)
Discovery port on which to send the broadcast (normally 32227) in the range 1025 to 65535 (Default 32227)
Length of time (seconds) to wait for devices to respond (Default 1.0 seconds)
Attempt to resolve host IP addresses to DNS names (Default )
Search for Alpaca devices that use IPv4 addresses. One or both of useIpV4 and useIpV6 must be True. (Default )
Search for Alpaca devices that use IPv6 addresses. One or both of useIpV4 and useIpV6 must be True. (Default )
or

member.summary: Returns an awaitable Task that provides a list of discovered Alpaca devices
member.param: Number of polls to send in the range 1 to 5
Interval (milliseconds) between each poll in the range 10 to 5000 milliseconds.
Discovery port on which to send the broadcast (normally 32227) in the range 1025 to 65535.
Length of time (seconds) to wait for devices to respond.
Attempt to resolve host IP addresses to DNS names
Search for Alpaca devices that use IPv4 addresses. One or both of useIpV4 and useIpV6 must be True.
Search for Alpaca devices that use IPv6 addresses. One or both of useIpV4 and useIpV6 must be True.
or

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Discovery.AlpacaDiscovery.ResolveIpAddressToHostName(System.Object)
member.summary: Resolve a host IP address to a host name
member.remarks: This first makes a DNS query and uses the result if found. If not found it then tries a Microsoft DNS call which also searches the local hosts and makes a netbios query. If this returns an answer it is use. Otherwise the IP address is returned as the host name

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Discovery.Finder.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a Alpaca Finder object that sends out a search request for Alpaca devices The results will be sent to the callback and stored in the cache Calling search and concatenating the results reduces the chance that a UDP packet is lost This may require firewall access

member.summary: Creates a Alpaca Finder object that sends out a search request for Alpaca devices The results will be sent to the callback and stored in the cache Calling search and concatenating the results reduces the chance that a UDP packet is lost This may require firewall access
member.param: Enforce correct casing of the port variable name in the Alpaca JSON discovery response.
An ILogger instance (or null) into which the Finder will log.

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Discovery.Finder.SearchIPv4
member.summary: Send out discovery message on each IPv4 broadcast address This dual targets NetStandard 2.0 and NetFX 3.5 so no Async Await Broadcasts on each adapters address as per Windows / Linux documentation

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Discovery.Finder.SearchIPv6
member.summary: Send out discovery message on the IPv6 multicast group This dual targets NetStandard 2.0 and NetFX 3.5 so no Async Await

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Discovery.Finder.SendDiscoveryMessage(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Send out the IPv4 and IPv6 messages on the specified discovery port

member.name: M:ASCOM.Alpaca.Discovery.Finder.LogMessage(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Format log messages according to thread number in order to make then easier to follow in the log
member.param: Method name
Message text

member.name: T:ASCOM.Alpaca.Discovery.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Tools providing Alpaca Discovery capabilities for Alpaca clients and devices. This namespace is delivered in NuGet package: ASCOM.Alpaca.Components except for the Responder class, which is delivered in NuGet package: ASCOM.Alpaca.Device to minimise its footprint.
